meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inconvertible.
meanings.sent1: The inconvertibilities of the ancient artifact made it impossible to restore.
meanings.sent2: The inconvertibilities of the currency exchange caused confusion among travelers.
meanings.sent3: The inconvertibilities of the jigsaw puzzle pieces led to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like the inconvertibilities of a solid rock.
meanings.sent5: The inconvertibilities of the lock made it seem like a puzzle waiting to be solved.

meanings.definition: The inability to be converted or changed.
meanings.sent1: The inconvertibilities of the old traditions clashed with modern ideas.
meanings.sent2: The inconvertibilities of his beliefs made compromise difficult.
meanings.sent3: The inconvertibilities of the stubborn mule made for a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: The inconvertibilities of her opinion were like a wall that couldn't be broken down.
meanings.sent5: The inconvertibilities of the weather made planning the event challenging.
